intro: Linanthus liniflorus, commonly known as the slender flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus liniflorus is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along stream banks.
